The Bravest Slayer- Chapter Two
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Library: Fan Fiction, Poetry, Birthday List, Links & Non-Fiction Archive: Epics In Progress, Section III: The Bravest Slayer- Chapter Two
By Mewger on Friday, October 1, 2004 - 07:03 am:

I was sneaking. Trying to locate the Dragon. And then, it hit me! A sword, it hit me with power! And then there was...

Nothing. A void of nothing. And then, a memory! A piece of one..

A horrid, dark figure loomed over me. All it was saying was.. (Ragedom... Dragon...Ragedom! Dragon!)

Then--voices.

"Now you've done it! I swear, you're worse than those idiotic Golems!"

"It looked fiendish to me! I just knew it was an enemy!"

"As far as I'm concerned you hurt an innocent monster. At least you should have called Master Newfang about it!"

"Master Newfang this, Master Newfang that! Do you ever act on your own?"

"Not in these situations! Ragedom doesn't belong to either of us! If someone is trespassing, it's Master Newfang who makes the decision on what to do!"

"Well, I just know he's going to thank me for taking care of this stray SkullMew. I just knew it was coming to steal something!"

"It's horrible that you judge a monster before you even meet them!"

"It's horrible that you're so off guard!"

Heavy footsteps. Someone new was approaching.

"Now now, what's the problem you two?"

I was shocked. That was human language! But the shape my blurry eyes made out was clearly monster...

"A stray monster came to the ranch and Dur whacked it with his sword. Now it's unconcious and probably hurt."

"Dur?"

"I was protecting the Ranch! Everyone knows that Ragedom is rich! A skilled thief is bound to want to try their hand here!"

"But as Lan was saying, it's no reason to attack without understanding."

"Thank you, Master Newfang."

"But as Dur was saying, Lan--you have to have your guard up as well. Some monsters aren't going to stop and chat with you about why they're here. You need to use discrimation. Between who you feel is safe, and who you feel isn't. You cannot trust everyone."

"Yes."

"Now move aside, let me see this monster..."

The voices ceased. Instead, I blurrily and dimly saw a large, green eye, staring at me..

And it was quite an eye. Or rather, it seemed, until I opened my eyes. So close to me, I realized that the eye... had writing on it? Ancient writing... I knew this writing! But from where?

I reached forward!

The dragon jumped back. Regaining my sight completely, I stared up, up, up at him.

He was absolutely huge. I was amazed! And yet, there was nothing brutish about him. He seemed very old to me, older then a Dragon should be... He was calm, and quite collected, and seemed very fair in his actions. I hoped he would have mercy on me for trespassing, especially since I didn't know why I was here.

"Whoa there, young monster! Trying to poke my eye out are we?", said the Dragon, grinning and laughing.

I looked around.

"Where am I?"

"You're in Ragedom, one of the finest monster ranches around. Now answer me a question. Who are you?"

"I'm...Devata.", I said, surprised that I remembered my name.

"Would you like to tell me why you are here, Devata?"

I froze.. Why WAS I were? I didn't.. know. At least not anymore.

"I don't know."

The dragon looked at me strangly. What was he thinking?

"Well, Devata..", he began, voice full of stability, almost nobility, as if he were an old and wise king making a difficult decision, "If you wish, you may stay with us here at Ragedom. My job is to take in the lost, and none seems more lost than you, my child!"

I was slightly relieved. I had found myself a home, it seemed.

"Thank you.", I said, still puzzled. How in the world did I get here?

(Ragedom... Dragon...Ragedom! Dragon!)

What was this? And why did it plague me?

"Well, come on, Mew!", cried the Durahan, glaring at me with ditrust.

The Durahan. He looked scathingly at me, as if I was some scamp of a stray! I was not! I knew I had a purpose, a reason for being here... but what was it?

And then, a calmer voice. A kinder voice.

"Ignore Dur, Devata. He's an idiot who can't handle others."

"It's you I can't handle, Lan!"

"Whatever, Dur. Look, Devata, you're welcome here."

I looked up at the kind Antlan. He had soft eyes and I could tell he was no brach warrior. Soft as they were, however, his eyes were sharp with a kind of intelligence that I knew was rare. Mind you, not wisdom, like the Dragon, but pure obtained intelligence. I knew that the Book in the corner of the Ranch was his and his alone.

The Durahan seemed to be just the opposite of the Antlan--full of arrogance and brute strength. His eyes glared deeply into you, intimidatingly--as if he were trying to size up everything and everyone for a fight. And a fight he had taken to me indeed! It would take some time for me to gain his trust, if ever.

But I was glad that I was welcomed by the Antlan, and walked side by side with the three monsters as they headed back to the House. Obviously training had ended for the day.

I sighed.

Would I ever learn why I was here?

(Ragedom... Dragon... Ragedom! Dragon!)

I just didn't know...

End Chapter Two

By Neck Warmer on Friday, October 1, 2004 - 07:40 am:

I still have no sense of plot, but the lenght is improved, and the descriptions are as good as ever.

By Mewger on Friday, October 1, 2004 - 12:43 pm:

Well, I only have one thing to say... wait and see what the plot is!

The story is supposed to be Devata's point of view, and since she seems rather confused about everything at the moment, how can this story relate to you directly what's going on? All in time will be revealed, just as it is revealed to Devata.

And thanks for saying I have good descriptions! ^_^
